fields.summary: Popular topics are still showing when I ask a question
Wrong url to topics on topics page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47657].
  {panel}

It seems that indexing of Confluence questions triggers a huge number of errors and thread dumps due to permission checks that are failing. 

This is caused by the bad usage of GET urls for delete actions in the UI when Confluence is configured to be accessed as anonymous. The logs can fill quite fast due to this bug as it logs over 10kb per request.

{noformat}
2015-04-13 10:14:47,581 ERROR [http-bio-8090-exec-203] [atlassian.plugin.web.DefaultWebInterfaceManager] filterFragmentsByCondition Could not evaluate condition 'co
m.atlassian.confluence.plugins.questions.conditions.AnswerPermissionCondition@7fe75f60' for descriptor: cq.answer.meta/cq.answer.meta.delete
 -- url: /display/xenserver/questions/1226224791/answers/1226224795/comments/1226224808 | userName: anonymous | action: viewquestion | space: 130351106
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.questions.internal.security.policy.SpacePermissionPolicy.isAuthorOfResource(SpacePermissionPolicy.java:94)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.questions.internal.security.policy.SpacePermissionPolicy.hasPermission(SpacePermissionPolicy.java:80)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.questions.internal.security.policy.SpacePermissionPolicy.hasPermissionWithMessage(SpacePermissionPolicy.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.questions.internal.security.PermissionServiceImpl.hasPermissionWithMessage(PermissionServiceImpl.java:94)
{noformat}
fields.summary: [atlassian.plugin.web.DefaultWebInterfaceManager] filterFragmentsByCondition Could not evaluate condition 'co m.atlassian.confluence.plugins.questions.conditions.QuestionPermissionCondition@ for descriptor: cq.question.meta/cq.question.meta.delete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47655].
  {panel}

This issue is already appear in the old version of Confluence question which compatible with Confluence 5.5.6

Steps:
- Try to insert a code block when create a Confluence Question/Answer
- Focus on the code block. You will see all button on the header is disabled
- Try to click on insert image button

Error:
- The insert image dialog still open, you can see add image and insert into the question/answer. It seems after insert the code block will be removed
- The analytic still tracking. In fact click on any button will still trigger analytic on the log
fields.summary: [Confluence question] In code block you can still be able to "insert image" and tracking analytic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47654].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a new question, and add a couple topics
# Upon the page reloading, click the pencil icon to begin editing the topics of this question
# Remove one or more topics
# Reload the page, and observe that the remove topics are still present

*Workaround:*
Edit the comment and remove the topic from within that form.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47636].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
* Load an existing question
* Without placing focus within the text editor for a new answer, either:
** Click on the Insert Image button
** Click on the Insert Link button and select the Attachments tab

*Result:*
The dialog does not load correctly, attachments cannot be inserted or uploaded and the following error is displayed

{{Could not upload the file to Confluence. The server is unavailable}}

A 404 REST request is displayed in the browser console:

GET https://answers-confluence.atlassian.com/rest/prototype/1/content/0/attachments.json?_=1409159791384 404 (404 Not Found)

featured field value not correct with rest/questions/1.0/topic

Demo bug

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47623].
  {panel}

The email notification that is send out when I add someone to a topic watchlist contains a broken link which results in a "Not Found" error page. This is because we have Confluence running under a context name and not under the root and the link does not include the context. This seems to be an issue specific to this email. It works fine in other CQ emails.

Email in Link points to: https://www.myserver.com/questions/topics/21266463/pmo?src=email
Correct would be: https://www.myserver.com/confluence/questions/topics/21266463/pmo?src=email

Proposed solution: The email should use the Confluence Server Base URL and not just the host.
fields.summary: Link to topic in topic watch list notification is missing context path

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47605].
  {panel}

We believe there may be a small subset of users who will experience this problem when logging in to Atlassian Answers now that the migration to Confluence Questions is complete.

Instead of being linked to their own user account, they will instead be linked to a different account with a similar name.  This appears to be related to the way in which Atlassian ID maps users to local account names.

We are still investigating the extent of this issue, and whether or not we can solve it via a bulk update.

If you encounter this problem, please comment on this issue and we should be able to solve it for your account with a once-off configuration change.

Allow administrative users to assign Groups to watch topics

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47592].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
- Run CQ in standalone mode (disable Confluence Spaces plugin)
- Go to Global Permissions (the CQ version)
- Enable anonymous access to Confluence Questions
- Go to a question with an image attached or directly to the confluence attachment link.

*Expected Behaviour*
- The Confluence Questions image is displayed

*Actual Behaviour*
Direct Link:
- The user is redirected to a login prompt
Confluence Question Page:
- The user is displayed a broken image

*Cause?*
This seems to happen because Confluence is still respecting the non-CQ, global anonymous usage permissions when accessing attachments/images in Confluence.  

*Side Note:*
If you enable the Confluence Spaces plugin, go to global permissions and enable *Use Confluence* permissions for anonymous users, then it works as expected once the Confluence Spaces plugin is disabled again. If you leave spaces enabled access issues to images are still prevalent.
fields.summary: Anonymous access to images in Confluence Questions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47589].
  {panel}

After importing all our content from our old forums and clearing out the demo content, questions is working great, except for users that went in during testing, they still see the following in the popular topics when they go to create a question:

Popular topics: development human-resources marketing

Where are these coming from / how do they get removed. They aren't in the labels table.

Thanks!

  {panel}

Hi Atlassian team,

in our Confluence configuration we set 

 "User email visibility" to "only visible to site administrators"

However, we use the Confluence Questions plugin and if we click there on a Contact and "Contact info", the email is displayed even to anonymous users.

As I am on vaccation for a few weeks, please contact olga.mendscheritski@exasol.com, if you need further information or have any news on this.

Kind regards,

Sebastian

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47579].
  {panel}

Behavior:
Click the new "Convert to comment" link below a submitted answer to convert it to a comment under a different answer or under the original question.

Expected:
The comment appears in the appropriate place with the original date of the comment.

Actual:
The date is updated to now, and the comments are sorted by the time they were either posted OR converted (e.g. "just a moment ago"), which puts comments out of chronological order, making them impossible to read/follow.
fields.summary: Converting an answer to a comment updates its date to now

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47578].
  {panel}

I've been noticing that creating a questions list on a Confluence page doesn't seem to be working if you use the default "popular" sorting.

*Steps to Recreate*
* create a test page on the wiki
* from the macro menu, select the "Questions List" macro
* put one or more labels in the topics text field.
* click save (don't change the sorting type from "popular")

The result that I've observed is that the macro will render with some sort of "no questions found" message even when the label(s) provided most certainly do have issues associated with them. Even some of our most popular questions don't show up in the "popular" feed. Is there some parameter or popularity criteria that can be altered to fix this?
fields.summary: "Popular" sorting isn't working for Questions List macro
Points are not shown correctly
Email mention links to "Page not found"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47570].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate*
# Install Confluence Question in your confluence
# Give Anonymous permission for Confluence question
# Give Anonymous permission for Confluence 
# Enter the ”Questions List”-macro to a page, check the box so that the ”Ask a Question”-button is shown. 
# Go to the page as an anonymous user. 
# Click ”Ask a question”.

User will be seeing the following error:
!err.JPG|thumbnail!

It will be better if user is shown a sign-up/log-in dialog instead of that error.
fields.summary: Unsuccessful An error occurred while trying to ask a question

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47566].
  {panel}

When trying to delete a topic with 0 questions and 0 watchers, the request seems to timeout. 

 !image-2016-01-19-09-44-04-533.png|thumbnail! 

The request is made via a REST DELETE request to http://(SERVER_NAME):8090/rest/questions/1.0/topic/(TOPIC_ID). Looking at the response, it appears to return "Failed to delete topic xxxxxxx".

There is nothing noted in the application logs to why this failed (at least I didnt see any).
fields.summary: Unable to delete topic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47564].
  {panel}

I have had success using variations of the other API methods, but anytime I attempt to use the /experts/period/{time} method, I get a 404 error back.

Examples of URLs I have tried with no success:

* https://mycq/rest/questions/1.0/experts/period/alltime
* https://mycq/rest/questions/1.0/experts/period/alltime?limit=20
* https://mycq/rest/questions/1.0/experts/period/10
* https://mycq/rest/questions/1.0/experts/period/52

None of the above work. They all result in 404 "null for uri: ..."

However, this request returns results:

* https://mycq/rest/questions/1.0/experts

Is the documentation posted online for [ExpertResource | https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence-questions/rest/resource_ExpertResource.html#path__experts_period_-time-.html] correct?
fields.summary: REST API's experts/period/{time} returns 404
Confluence Questions doesn't show a friendly datetime straight away after leaving a comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47560].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
To prevent low quality topic and reduce spam we should prevent with low reputation to create topic when rate limitation is enabled.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Enabled reputation based permissions for creating of topics.
fields.summary: User with low reputation shouldn't be able to create topic when rate limitation is enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47559].
  {panel}

We are deploying "Answers" at our institute to an audience who are not generally familiar with the culture of "Stack Exchange" and the like.

As a result, they are not pre-conditioned to "accept" answers.

Despite the presence of an "accept" answer button, users tend not to notice it or use it.

I think a little more human factor consideration on Atlassian's part could yield slightly redesigned forms which prompt the poser to use the "accept'' feature for questions which appear to accurately and fully answer the question as posed. This can be done tactfully, with little addition of verbiage, and will result in a product which when deployed will more likely to be used as intended, and create more value to your client (i.e. requiring less heavy-handed training). A few places where the user can be guided: in the form which collects the posers question; in the email notification indicating the existence of a new question; in the form where the poser reviews answers and none have yet been accepted...

Thanks
fields.summary: Answers insufficently guides question posers to accept/reject provided answers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47556].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there are two paths in the code that check the rate limiting threshold when a user is answering a question. One of the paths presents an error, i.e. "You've answered too many questions in 1 day." and the other, "You're not permitted." Which is a bit generic, and doesn't help the customer to understand what the problem is. It is not clear which conditions trigger one path over another.

In this case, the user is still able to comment on questions, s/he is only unable to answer questions.

h3. Suggested Solution
We should ensure that both paths would produce a recognisable error so the user knows what the problem is and why they are not able to answer questions.
 
h3. Workaround 
If a few of the user's answers are accepted, the rate will decrease and allow them to answer.
fields.summary: Rate limiting error message is too generic

Attempting to migrate questions from a home brew questions page into CQ. 
Macros is simple as emoticons in the body like this:
<ac:emoticon ac:name=\"sad\" />
are blowing up with {"message":"com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlParsingException: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 580. Parser message: Undeclared namespace prefix "ac"\n at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,580]",

Is importing these using the ImportAPI (or any other API) even possible?
fields.summary: No documentation for importing macros with the import API
Save question drafts
How can I allow users to edit a page without giving them permission to create pages in the space?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47540].
  {panel}

Up until now we weren't scanning Atlassian Answers on a regular basis, although every once in a while either one of the devs or someone from the marketing team would pick up a thread related to one of our products (where it was mentioned by name) or to a topic which triggered our interest (this is far more difficult to track because of the infinite number of ways that a question can be phrased). Recently I ran a thorough Atlassian Answers search and found some questions which we failed to notice on time.
  
My question: is it possible (and if yes, where can I find how to do this) to set up a series of keyword-based notifications? By this I mean:
- product names
- wording combinations (such as "physical board" or "standup").
 
For the time being I've set up Google Alerts (for example,  site:[answers.atlassian.com|http://answers.atlassian.com/] physical board), but I'm looking for a more reliable way to keep track of the questions being posted on Atlassian Answers.
fields.summary: Allow email subscriptions to be configured based on search terms
Option to add a label to other user questions
Questions for Confluence priced on a per-moderator basis.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47537].
  {panel}

*Reproduction*
* Open a new question
* Start a new comment
* To submit, press {{⌘}} + {{*S*}}

*Expected Results*
* Comment is submitted to the Question

*Actual Results*
* The comment is discarded
* A validation message indicates that the Answer cannot be blank

My inference is that {{⌘}} + {{*S*}} is mapped to submit the current ANSWER. The proper user experience would rather be that the shortcut submits whatever latest text session.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut for submission doesn't trigger as expected
Decrease Reputation Points needed in AAC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47527].
  {panel}

h3. Description
Currently. questions for confluence will not return any result when a user tried to search for a topic and keyword at the same time.

h3. Suggestion
Provide the ability to search for questions topic and keyword from contents.
fields.summary: Ability to search questions topic and keyword in the answers
Webhooks for Confluence Questions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47519].
  {panel}

I'm sure this must have been raised by now, but could not find anything relevant.
I've been using Atlassian Answers for a few months now and very actively in the last month - what strikes me is that every day there are tons of questions asked, which are later deleted and it's obvious that there are not questions at all but searches (and I'm not talking about all the spam threads, those are pretty obvious too).
It seems that this confusion comes from the fact that the largest and most prominent textbox on the front page is the one for asking questions, containing the text "What do you want to know?". This seems really confusing. I've been using Answers for months and still regularly end up on the second step of asking a question when I'm actually searching for something. The real search box is squashed somewhere in the upper right corner.
I think with some little changes the UX can be vastly improved and the number of those false questions will greatly be reduced.
fields.summary: The search box should be the most prominent widget on the landing page
24-hour wait for comments for low-point users in Q&A is inappropriately long
Threshold Points for each action be changeable
Information of who deleted the question and when it was deleted
Insert a banner into Confluence Questions home page
Related questions list shouldn't be limited
Notify new answers from Confluence Questions on HipChat
User is forced to select a space when using the 'Create Dialog' to ask a question
Topics watched should be listed in a personal page for each logged in user
As an administrator I would like to grant permissions to Space questions without allowing access to global Questions
text running over the right hand side

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47497].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Current, when users ask a question, only other questions appear in the search results. Much like the Confluence search bar that returns results from questions AND spaces, the results in Questions should also search Confluence pages. This will help users in the end because if the answer already exists in a page, there is no need to create a new question. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a feature that searches Confluence content as well as Questions and returns the results to users.
fields.summary: Include Confluence pages in Questions search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47484].
  {panel}

h3. Step to replicate
# Create a question and attach an attachmen to the question.
# Edit the question and move it to another space.
# Edit the question again.

Observed Result:
The following ERROR appear in the browser
{code}
Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form to create a support ticket which will include this information.

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

Return to site homepage…
Cause

java.lang.NullPointerException: inputStream cannot be null
at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:204)
Stack Trace:[hide]

java.lang.NullPointerException: inputStream cannot be null
at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:204)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.AttachmentDataStream$InputStreamWrapper.<init>(AttachmentDataStream.java:43)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.filesystem.FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.rawBinaryWrapper(FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.java:155)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.filesystem.FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.saveDataForAttachment(FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.java:150)
at 
{code}

The attachment which is stored in the filesystem are not moved to the new location after the question is moved to the new space. The attachment still exist in the old location in the filesystem. Because the question in the new space is trying to refer to the attachment in the new location, it could not find the attachment which resulted in the ERROR. 

For example
Before the question was moved to the new space, the attachment is stored in the following location in the filesystem:
{panel}
/home/jing/atlassian/atlassian-confluence-5.6.6/data/attachments/ver003/172/223/59473922/146/60/59310146/59441182
{panel}
After it has been moved it is still in the same location:
{panel}
/home/jing/atlassian/atlassian-confluence-5.6.6/data/attachments/ver003/172/223/59473922/146/60/59310146/59441182
{panel}

By right, the value {{/172/223/59473922}} in the path above should be difference as it is suppose to be reffering to  new spaceid as explained here https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Hierarchical+File+System+Attachment+Storage.
fields.summary: Moving question with attachment cause the question to be no longer editable with  "A system error has occurred" ERROR
Taxonomist badge not working
